title: Security and Privacy for High Value Bottle Sales
metaTitle: Security and Privacy for High Value Bottle Sales | Proof Cellars
metaDescription: How to protect yourself when selling high value wine and spirits. Covers avoiding scams, protecting identity, safe shipping, and avoiding unsafe meetups.
summary: High value bottles attract attention, including from scammers. This guide covers how to protect yourself, your privacy, and your bottles when selling.

sections.heading: What to Do Next
content: When selling high value bottles, your first priority is choosing the right buyer. Avoid classifieds, social media marketplaces, and cash meetups.
Work with established buyers who have verifiable business presence and do not require in-person meetings with strangers.
list: Research potential buyers before sharing information
Avoid platforms that require meetups with strangers
Use buyers with established business presence
Do not share detailed inventory publicly
Keep valuable bottles secure until transaction is confirmed

sections.heading: What Information Matters for Pricing
content: For valuation, we need bottle details. You can share these securely through our form or by texting to 213-770-9463.
list: Producer names and vintages
Quantities and sizes
Photos of labels and condition
Original packaging
Storage history if relevant to provenance

sections.heading: Common Mistakes to Avoid
content: Scammers target high value bottles with fake payment schemes, meetup robberies, and identity theft. Understanding common tactics helps you avoid them.
list: Posting detailed inventory on public forums or social media
Meeting strangers at your home
Accepting unusual payment methods (gift cards, wire transfers to unknown accounts)
Shipping before payment clears
Sharing personal information beyond what is needed

sections.heading: How the Process Works
content: We are designed to be secure for sellers.
list: Submit photos and information through our form or text to 213-770-9463
We provide a written offer with no personal information required beyond contact details
If you accept, we arrange insured shipping or pickup from a location you choose
Payment is issued after we receive and verify the bottles
No meetups at private residences are required

sections.heading: Privacy and Safety Notes
content: We do not share seller names or addresses publicly. Your transaction is confidential.
Shipping is insured. You are protected during transit.
Payment is handled through standard business channels. We do not use unusual methods that could indicate fraud.
If something feels wrong during any transaction, stop and verify. Legitimate buyers understand caution.

faqs.question: How do I know you are legitimate?
faqs.answer: We are an established business with a verifiable presence. We do not ask for unusual payments, require meetups at your home, or pressure you to move quickly.

faqs.question: Is my information safe?
faqs.answer: We use your contact information to communicate about the transaction only. We do not share seller information publicly.

faqs.question: What about meetups?
faqs.answer: We do not require meetups at private residences. If pickup is needed, it can be from a neutral location or professional storage where permitted.

faqs.question: How is shipping protected?
faqs.answer: We arrange insured shipping. You are protected against damage or loss during transit.

faqs.question: What if payment does not arrive?
faqs.answer: We pay through standard business methods after receiving bottles. Payment timing is transparent and discussed before you ship.

faqs.question: Should I get multiple offers?
faqs.answer: Getting multiple offers is reasonable. Be cautious about sharing detailed inventory widely on public platforms. Direct inquiries to established buyers are safer.

faqs.question: What are signs of a scam?
faqs.answer: Red flags include: requests for unusual payment methods, pressure to act quickly, requests to meet at your home, offers to pay more than you expected without verification, and requests for personal information beyond contact details.
